TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON Reshetnikov , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , former Representative of GPE at ORG , PERSON , First Deputy Minister of ORG , and PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE charges of rape were brought against the applicant , and he was detained pending the investigation .
On DATE the ORG of GPE convicted the applicant of illegal deprivation of liberty , sexual abuse and attempted rape and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
The applicant appealed , alleging a violation of his right to defence .
On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment on appeal , having considered that the applicant ’s right to defence had been violated during the trial , and remitted the case for a retrial .
On DATE the Presidium of the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE by way of supervisory review and remitted the judgment of DATE for a new appeal hearing .
On DATE the ORG reduced the applicant ’s sentence to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and upheld the rest of the judgment on appeal .

Following the applicant ’s request , on DATE ORG of GPE , having considered that the applicant ’s right to defence had not been respected at the stage of the pre - trial investigation , quashed the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , by way of supervisory review , and remitted the case for a retrial . ORG ordered that the applicant should be remanded in custody pending determination of the criminal charge against him . The decision was taken in the applicant ’s absence .

Following the quashing of the applicant ’s conviction by way of supervisory review the applicant sought to have criminal proceedings instituted against the judges who tried his case in DATE , without success .
The applicant also brought civil proceedings seeking to recover damages for his unlawful conviction of DATE , as upheld on appeal on DATE . On DATE ORG in the final instance dismissed his claims .
On DATE ORG of GPE again convicted the applicant .
On DATE ORG overturned the judgment of DATE on appeal , because the trial court had not respected the applicant ’s rights to defence , and remitted the case for a retrial .
On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of sexual abuse and attempted rape and sentenced him to DATE months’ imprisonment .
On DATE ORG upheld the conviction on appeal .

Following ORG decision of DATE to remand the applicant in custody , on CARDINAL DATE ORG of Chelyabinsk scheduled a hearing on the applicant ’s case and held that the applicant should remain in custody . The decision was given in the applicant ’s absence , and the latter was informed about it only after it had become final . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s request to restore the time - limit for appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . However , on DATE ORG upheld the decision to keep the applicant in detention .
In the meantime , on DATE ORG of GPE extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . The applicant ’s appeal against this decision was examined by ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG of Chelyabinsk , having convicted the applicant , held that he should remain in custody .
On DATE ORG , having quashed the judgment of DATE , held that the preventive measure of detention imposed on the applicant should remain unchanged .
On DATE the ORG of GPE scheduled a hearing on the applicant ’s case and held that the applicant should remain in custody . On DATE ORG upheld the above decision on appeal .
On DATE ORG of GPE ruled once again that the applicant should remain in custody . On DATE ORG upheld the above decision on appeal .

On DATE the ORG held that the preventive measure imposed on the applicant should remain unchanged . On DATE ORG upheld the above decision on appeal . As indicated above the applicant was convicted by ORG on DATE .
